pageContext.description:
A complete but worn mid to late Bronze Age tanged and lugged chisel or hammer/punch, dating from the Blackmoor/Ewart Park phase, c 1020- 800BC. The chisel is triangular in shape narrowing towards the point, with a square lug projecting either side 17.3mm from the wider end. The lugs are chipped and worn. The chisel is rectangular in cross section. The chisel is a dark brown orange colour, with patches of green patina showing from underneath where the chisel has been chipped and damaged. The chisel measures 59.5mm in length, 12.6mm in width, and 5.2mm in thickness. It weighs 10.48g.



Similar records on the database are YORYM-71EBF0 and HESH-51B7E2
